alert.note: Alert for Ottawa (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 22 at 11:37AM EST by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: .An ice jam may cause water to infiltrate the lowlands along the Grand River. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by ice jams continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Michigan, including the following county, Ottawa. * WHEN...Through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Localized flooding of low lying areas and property along the Grand River will be possible. Rapid water level fluctuations may occur due to heavy ice cover on the river and possible ice jam formation. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - As of Monday morning, a significant ice jam that had formed on the river near the highway 231 bridge, has moved downstream to near the Connor Bayou area, and is causing flooding in parts of Robinson Township. As this ice jam slowly moves downriver over the next few days, additional flooding is possible, including at some areas along the river that typically don`t have flooding problems. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
